abstract: After saying he could - and would - veto district lines from the Legislature if they were not drawn fairly, the governor appeared to back away on Wednesday, saying a veto "would inject a certain amount of chaos and uncertainty" into the process.
snippet: After saying he could - and would - veto district lines from the Legislature if they were not drawn fairly, the governor appeared to back away on Wednesday, saying a veto "would inject a certain amount of chaos and uncertainty" into the process.
lead_paragraph: As the process of redrawing legislative boundaries heads to the courts in many other states, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo on Wednesday said that he hoped to avoid that outcome in New York, warning that chaos would ensue if a judge was forced to sort out the state's redistricting procedures.

headline.main: Cuomo Warns of Chaos if Redistricting Fight Goes to a Judge
